medical_history.chief_complaint: Visual-field loss and a mass in the brain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 weeks before admission with loss of vision in the right eye and diplopia while jogging; these symptoms resolved spontaneously after several minutes. Four days before admission, symptoms recurred transiently, and the patient bumped into a tree while running. On the morning of admission, dizziness and loss of vision in the right lower visual field in both eyes developed, which did not resolve and resulted in difficulty driving.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of gastroesophageal reflux disease, Helicobacter pylori infection, and recent hematuria. Previous inguinal herniorrhaphies.
medical_history.family_history: An uncle had an inoperable primary brain tumor; the patientâ€™s siblings and children were healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Divorced, has children, physically active (runs daily and competes in marathons), drinks alcohol in moderation, has never smoked, no recent exposure to ill persons, tuberculosis, or asbestos.
